item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Two people in love, alone, isolated from the world, that's beautiful." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Making love with a woman and sleeping with a woman are two separate passions, not merely different but opposite. Love does not make itself felt in the desire for copulation (a desire that extends to an infinite number of women) but in the desire for shared sleep (a desire limited to one woman)." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "We can never know what to want, because, living only one life, we can neither compare it with our previous lives nor perfect it in our lives to come." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Faeries, come take me out of this dull world, For I would ride with you upon the wind, Run on the top of the dishevelled tide, And dance upon the mountains like a flame." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "WINE comes in at the mouth And love comes in at the eye; That's all we shall know for truth Before we grow old and die. I lift the glass to my mouth, I look at you, and sigh." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard are sweeter: therefore, ye soft pipes, play on." -- John Keats

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Give me books, French wine, fruit, fine weather and a little music played out of doors by somebody I do not know." -- John Keats

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "You are always new. The last of your kisses was even the sweetest; the last smile the brightest; the last movement the gracefullest." -- John Keats

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by Truman Capote
Tipsuda add a quote by Joanne Harris
item.description: "I believe that being happy is the only important thing. Happiness. Simple as a glass of chocolate or torturous as the heart. Bitter. Sweet. Alive." -- Joanne Harris

item.title: Tipsuda add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "So long as you write what you wish to write, that is all that matters; and whether it matters for ages or only for hours, nobody can say. " -- Virginia Woolf
